title: Verbal Description: Michelle LaVaughn Robinson Obama
transcript:
Michelle LaVaughn Robinson Obama is an oil painting on linen created by Amy Sherald in 2018. The
painting is roughly six feet tall and five feet wide. Michelle Obama, the former First Lady of the United
States, seated against a solid, pale blue background. She is centered on the canvas and wears a
sleeveless black and white dress with colored accents in a geometric print like you might find on a quilt.
Her skin is rendered in shades of gray with subtle modeling that indicates the contours of her face and
arms.
Her hair, parted in the middle, falls in large, buoyant waves just past her bare shoulders. The lobe of her
left ear, sporting a pearl earring, is just visible. Her face is shown in three-quarter view, her facial
expression serious. She gazes out of the canvas, making eye contact with the viewer. Her right arm is
sharply bent, her elbow on her lap and her wrist curved under her chin. We can see three fingernails on
her right hand, polished in cornflower blue. Her left arm cuts in front of her body, bent at a 90-degree
angle at the elbow with her forearm draped over her bent knee.

The flowing skirt of Michelle Obama’s dress expands in a triangular shape to occupy the lower portion of
the canvas, extending beyond the bottom edge of the composition. Black, and gray triangles and
semicircles are distributed across the white base of the fabric, accented by stripes of red, pink, and
yellow.
